txt: We need more collectively-owned businesses, starting with grocery stores.
JCPS should get rid of its confusing lottery system.
No more storage units or apartments. Revitalize what we already have. Stop sprawl.
Just as we have trash cans on many street corners, we should have recycling cans as well.
To solve challenges (like poverty, hunger, homelessness) much more collaboration is needed - government, business, nonprofit, neighborhood.
We need to change many one-way streets to two-ways to encourage safety in our neighborhoods like Old Lou & Shelby Park.
Vehicles (including the likes of police and utility vehicles) should not be able to idle for long periods.
We should promote the free Volunteer Income Tax Assistance tax-filing program.
Subdivisions should allow other types of zoning to create walkable communities.
Trash cans are not big enough so lids are often left open and trash becomes litter.
We need to get rid of corruption
I'd like to see night lighting that is less impactful on migrating birds.
Revamp our city's process for prosecuting rape cases to hold perpetrators accountable and protect public safety.
Taxes on parcels should include potential value, with the goal of pricing out people squatting on parking lots downtown.
Louisville should do more to act on climate change.
Only allow Lime and other motorized scooter companies in neighborhoods with low levels of car ownership.
There are many trees in Louisville that should be better maintained or cut down.
Worker owned cooperatives should be encouraged by the city.
Stop LG&E's solar program which burdens the cost of solar to it's customers instead of the company investing in green future energy sources.
Protect abortion access in Louisville
Louisville needs comprehensive public transit.
Louisville should prioritize bringing an NBA team to town.
Improve Louisville roads.  Too many potholes and faded white/yellow lines are impossible to see at night and in the rain.
JCPS should undergo an external (outside of KY) non-union review.
We need fewer CBD and vape shops.
If we are to be a world class city, we need light rail. It would help reduce pollution, traffic congestion, and drivers stress
We need to mandate green/garden roofs downtown to combat the heat island effect.
Universal access to high quality, affordable preschool should be a priority for Louisville.
We need to pay closer attention to local pols. Just because they have a D by their name does not mean they govern in a progressive way.
The school system must rethink policies to  help all children to be their best, all around education as much as possible.  Preschool early.
can you explain, a little more about what you mean by economic power.
We need our schools to be safe places where teachers can teach and students can learn.
Recycle bins need to be cans with lids. They are currently too small and people end up putting recyclables in the trash.
Affordable housing that’s not a 5% of outrageous priced housing; a tree and urban greening policy that is project by project.
Enact a soda tax and mandate only 18 or older can purchase them.
Retest all drivers every four years at renewal and use simulators for the road test.
Louisville should invest more in bike infrastructure.
Create a local tax deduction for employers who establish student loan repayment programs.
Louisville residents need to be educated in cultural humility
Louisville needs to understand that it takes revenue to "fully fund" programs. Advocating  investment and resisting higher taxes is futile.
Louisville should study whether bussing is positively enhancing opportunities for African American children.
Marijuana should be legal for medical and recreational purposes and taxed to provide funding to the city and not the illegal drug dealers.
Louisville should put more money into the pension system through higher taxes.
Real answers for homeless population with affordable housing.
We need to stop every bit of drug trafficking even it means assistance the national guard.
Louisville needs better mass transit
Bring back Shelby Park’s library
Charter schools should be an option for all children, not just certain ones.
Louisville Public Media betters our community.
Share the power. Term limits for metro council as they are in most other elected positions here and across the country.
Metro government needs to stop letting a few loud, wealthy people stop progress and growth in Louisville.
Comprehensive and age appropriate sex education is essential.
We must fully fund our public libraries and social services at a level suitable to our city's ambitions for equity and growth.
The city should confiscate abandoned properties, renovate them, and give them to homeless and impoverished families.
Louisville should encourage shopping local by making it easier for small businesses to fill vacant spaces.
Rebuild older areas and stop destroying wooded areas for new construction.
I think the police, on balance, treat citizens with respect.
Offer summer programs that teach youth how to identify fake news and disinformation.
Public schooling is dysfunctional and needs to be overhauled.
Fix the environmental injustice that is Rubbertown. The toxic chemicals are compromising our health, especially among children and elderly.
Louisville should be a leader when it comes to climate change and renewable energies
Figure out how to remove forever chemicals from our water supply.
There should be a natural burial ground in Louisville.
There should be a train available that runs between the airport and downtown (at least). The proposed Louisville transit maps would be ideal
Louisvillians have a strong sense of citizenship.
Louisville needs to protect our green spaces by encouraging renewal of rundown areas instead of urban sprawl.
Trolleys should run between Bardstown Road, downtown and Frankfort Avenue Friday night to Sunday afternoon.

Institute annual car inspection requirements and use portion of funds to combat city pollution or other city initiatives.
Louisville needs to do more to address graffiti than simply paint over it.
Louisville should clean up all the garbage and junk along the edges of the freeways and roadways.
We should encourage/incentivize independent businesses (restaurants, stores) - too many chains

We need a county wide universal basic income. This would help homeless and poor. Make Louisville the leader in humanity.
We need more trees. Desperately
Student behavior challenges comes from trauma, let's add social and emotional classes K-12 to connect kids with tools, language and support.
Traffic is horrible on every highway and needs to be addressed.

Old Kmart on Taylorsville needs more community friendly establishments-local restaurants, organic groceries and bars/less medical offices.

Louisville is a great place to live and work.
